page.title: 08Drove Cottage page 1
page.content: In former times, there were many sheep reared on the farms in Compton and the surrounding area. Dr. Robinson's house is on the path of one of the old drove roads which ran from Compton Street up to the Downs. So when the Robinson family moved into the house 13 years ago, they changed the name fro "The Cottage" to "Drove Cottage". Some of the beams in the cottage date from around 1500. They are not sure where the beams came from, possibly ships' timbers or even the church. Apprentice marks can be clearly seen on some of the beams. This sugests that the timber was cut especially for the house. Originally, Drove Cottage had a thatched roof. The Robinson's had the thatch removed and replaced by old tiles.
